Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Gadoxetic Acid-Enhanced MRI, ECCM-MRI, and CE-CT for Hepatic Staging in Suspected CRCLM

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1:1 to receive gadoxetic acid-enhanced MRI, ECCM-MRI, or CE-CT.

Participants.evidence: the trial included patients aged 18 years or older with suspected CRCLM.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1:1 to receive gadoxetic acid-enhanced MRI, ECCM-MRI, or CE-CT.

Objective.evidence: assessed the impact of gadoxetic acid-enhanced MRI, ECCM-MRI, and CE-CT as first-line imaging modalities in patients with suspected colorectal cancer liver metastases (CRCLM).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the proportion of patients requiring further imaging for a confident diagnosis.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated list with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 360 patients were randomised, with 118, 112, and 112 patients in the gadoxetic acid-enhanced MRI, ECCM-MRI, and CE-CT groups, respectively.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Further imaging was required in 0% of the gadoxetic acid-enhanced MRI group, 17.0% of the ECCM-MRI group, and 39.3% of the CE-CT group (P < 0.001).
